items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.20 submission and recommendation: 
			 
Article 9.20 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all Districts assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.  
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.20 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the faculty personnel action as submitted.

items.item_details:
1. Minimum Wage Increase
Hourly wage increases for those classifications affected by the new minimum wage law for Santa Clara County.
	 
2. Employment
The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant, and Voluteer Personnel Actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
The curriculum proposals have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and by the Instructional Policies and Curriculum Committee (IPCC) acting on behalf of the local Academic Senate. The rigor of the approval process assures that each new recommendation has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and fills a clear need not being served by existing curriculum.
	 
LASER 104: Fiber Laser Technology
	 
In addition, the courses below have been proposed to address recent Title 5 changes regarding repeatability of Active Participatory courses.
	 
DANCE 013A: Dancers' Workshop - Student, Large Group
DANCE 013B: Dancers' Workshop - Student, Small Group
DANCE 013C: Dancers' Workshop - Student, Solo/Duet
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the new courses proposed by San Jose City College.

items.item_details: At the recommendation of Xilinx Inc., the Evergreen Valley College Library was awarded a grant of $500 from the Xilinx Community Fund, a corporate advised fund of the Silicon Valley Community Foundation.  The grant is for educational support and online access to the Silicon Valley Business Journal.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept grant funds awarded to the Evergreen Valley College Library from Xilinx Community Fund.
items.item_text: Acceptance of Grant Funds - Evergreen Valley College
items.item_text_raw: 7. Acceptance of Grant Funds - Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details: SJCC has been participating in the Calteach Initiative (Aurora Grant) since Spring 2007.  The purpose of the Aurora Grant is to encourage high level students majoring in STEM fields to consider a career in science or math education in the K-12 system.  SJCC students, who are enrolled in a science major's class or a high level math course (calculus level), take a 3 unit, UC/SCU transferable course: Education 14 - Field Experience in Math and Science.  During the 2 unit lecture portion of this class, students learn current teaching methodology for K-12 math and science education.  For the 1 unit lab component students work in the classrooms with experienced math and science teachers in local elementary, middle or high schools.  Students who successfully complete this class receive a stipend to both encourage them to take this class and to offset the expenses in commuting to the local schools for their lab experience.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the campus to spend the balance of funds remaining from last year, $3150. In addition, the grant has additionally allocated $2000 this year.
items.item_text: Use of Grant Funds - Aurora Grant - SJCC
items.item_text_raw: 8. Use of Grant Funds - Aurora Grant - SJCC

items.item_details: This item is presented as a follow up to the November 13, 2012, Joint Signing of an MOU between Milpitas Unified School District and San Jose-Evergreen Community College District governing boards for the establishment of a "Joint-use 21st Century Education Center. Board members agreed to periodic joint meetings to ensure continuity and timely completion of the project. This report complies with board requests by presenting the joint work of staff and an agreed upon framework for production of a formal "land lease agreement." This framework includes the guiding mission and vision of both boards, the collaborative principles and guidelines to be used by staff in the effectuation of that vision and the key components necessary for the development of the terms for a land lease agreement. It is expected that each board will receive the land lease agreement for "first reading action" in April 2013, followed by a second reading action at their respective meetings in May 2013.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept the "Status Report" prepared collaboratively by Chancellor Cepeda and Superintendent Matsuoka.
items.item_text: SJECCD and MUSD Status Report: Guidelines, Principles and Proposed Terms for Land Lease Agreement

items.item_details: The Board has already approved the Child Development Grants for fiscal year 2011-2012.  This action transfers $8,443.00 from the CCTR-1325 contract to the CSPP-1582 contract, as there was an increased need for funding for the preschool group, and a decreased need for the toddler group.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the contract amendements attached for the Child Development Grants for FY 2011-2012, in the amount of $8,443.00.

items.item_details:
APPROVE AS ACTION ITEMS 
Preconstruction Agreement – KITCHELL CEM INC. – Lease/Leaseback Contractor, San Jose City College (SJCC) Theater & Vocational Technology Project
	 
At the Board meetings held March 13, 2012 and June 12, 2012, Program Management team and District legal counsel presented information and details regarding the Lease/Leaseback (LLB) project delivery method.  Subsequently, on July 10, 2012 the Board approved this method for two Measure G-2010 projects, including the SJCC Theater & Vocational Technology project, and approved a design agreement with Marcy Wong Donn Logan Architects on July 10, 2012 to provide programing services for the SJCC Theater & Vocational Technology project.  
	 
In keeping with that process, a Request for Qualifications (RFQ) for Lease/Leaseback Construction Services, including preconstruction services was issued on August 6, 2012. Twelve Statements of Qualifications (SOQ’s) were received.  A Selection Committee comprised of District and College faculty and staff reviewed, scored and ranked the SOQ’s, pre-qualified the five highest ranked firms and conducted in-person interviews with each firm. Each firm then received a score from the committee based on their presentations. Following the interviews and committee scoring and ranking, these five pre-qualified firms then submitted sealed proposals for lump sum preconstruction services and fee percentages for construction services.
	 
Based on the combination of points awarded and fee proposal, KITCHELL CEM INC. was determined to be the successful firm by providing the “best value” to the District.  Their proposal includes a fixed fee for preconstruction services [including design support, subcontract bidding and Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) development] of $168,888 and construction service fees and percentages to be applied to the Guaranteed Maximum Price.  The GMP and Site & Facilities Lease will be brought to the Board for approval once complete per conventional Lease/Leaseback contracting.
	 
The Board is asked to approve an Agreement with KITCHELL CEM INC. for preconstruction services in the amount of $168,888 and construction service fees and percentages to be applied to the Guaranteed Maximum Price for the Theater & Vocational Technology Project at SJCC.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Agreement with KITCHELL CEM INC. for preconstruction services in the amount of $168,888 and construction service fees and percentages to be applied to the Guaranteed Maximum Price for the Theater & Vocational Technology Project at SJCC.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 - Agreement with KITCHELL CEM INC. for Preconstruction of San Jose City College (SJCC) Theater & Vocational Technology Project.
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2010 - Agreement with KITCHELL CEM INC. for Preconstruction of San Jose City College (SJCC) Theater & Vocational Technology Project.

items.item_details:
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee, appointed by the Board of Trustees, has a responsibility under the provisions of Proposition 39 to inform the public, review expenditures and present an annual report to the Board of Trustees.
	 
The web-based Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee’s 2011-2012 Annual Report is presented to the Board of Trustee’s for acceptance by the 2011-2012 Committee Chair, Ms. Kathleen Kyne.
	 
This report is available for review using the following web link: http://sjebond.com/sje/
A printable version of this web-based report is also attached.
	 
The Board is asked to approve the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee’s 2011-2012 Annual Report.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept through action the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee’s 2011-2012 Annual Report.

items.item_details: On February 12, 2013, the Board of Trustees participated in a study session focusing in two areas:  1) Board Governance/Development and Team Building; and  2) Budget Principles, Guidelines and Priorities.  One of the follow up actions resulting from this session was the appointment of committee chairs by the President of the Board. In advance of this action, Board President Mayra Cruz requested that trustees indicate their interests. It is expected that President Cruz will formally appoint committee chairs.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the President of the Board of Trustees appoint chairs for established committees of the SJECCD Board of Trustees.
items.item_text: Board Governance: Appointment of Board Committee Chairs
items.item_text_raw: 5. Board Governance: Appointment of Board Committee Chairs

items.item_details: On January 31, 2013, President Obama issued a Presidential Proclamation proclaiming February 2013 as National African American History Month. In support of this proclamation and in celebration of the achievements of African American faculty, administrators, staff and students, Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College organized many events in which African American culture was celebrated. It is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 22613-1 in support of February 2013 as Black/African American History Month.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 22613-1 in support of February 2013 as Black/African American History Month.
items.item_text: Resolution No. 22613-1 in Support of February 2013 as Black/African American History Month
